clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Mechanisms and Predictors of VEGF Receptor Inhibitor- or Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor-Associated Hypertension and Cardiovascular Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Novel Mechanisms and Predictors of VEGF Receptor Inhibitor- or Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor-Associated Hypertension and Cardiovascular Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand the effect of vascular endothelial growth factor tyrosine kinase (VEGF) inhibitor, immune checkpoint-inhibitor (ICI), and combination treatment on blood pressure and blood vessel function.

primary_outcome.description: Mean 24 hour blood pressure from ambulatory 24 hour recording

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of post-treatment to pre-treatment change in digital pulse amplitude
secondary_outcome.description: Digital pulse amplitude will be measured using peripheral artery tonometry

arm_group.arm_group_label: Combination (VEGF inhibitor + ICI, or combination of ICI)

intervention.description: Baseline: Subjects will undergo an abbreviated physical exam, review changes in medical history since last oncology visit, blood collection, urine collection, blood pressure and heart rate in triplicate, baseline and hyperemic digital velocity time interval (VTI) using pulse amplitude tonometry, cubital vein endothelial cell harvest, and ambulatory 24 blood pressure measurement. Follow-up Visit (approx 1 month after starting treatment): Review changes in medications and any medical events that happened since the last visit, an abbreviated physical exam, blood collection, urine collection, blood pressure and heart rate in triplicate, baseline and hyperemic velocity time interval (VTI), digital pulse amplitude tonometry, endothelial cell harvest, and ambulatory 24 blood pressure.
intervention.arm_group_label: Combination (VEGF inhibitor + ICI, or combination of ICI)

study_pop.textblock: Participants with cancer that will be receiving VEGF inhibitor, ICI, or combination (VEGF inhibitor plus ICI or combination ICI treatment), or not receiving any treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, age 40 - 75 years old
- Diagnosis of cancer
- Receiving VEGF inhibitor, ICI, or combination (VEGF inhibitor + ICI or combination ICI) treatment, or not receiving any treatment.
- Normal blood pressure or blood pressure treated to < 140/90 mm Hg with â‰¤2 antihypertensive medications
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of peripheral artery disease
- History of a heart attack within 1 year
- History of a stroke within 1 year
- Diabetes
- Life expectancy < 3 months
- Women who are pregnant
- Women who are nursing

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in this article, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices).
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication.
